page.title: 10Trade Local Shop Northboro'
page.content: The shop is a small supermarket selling a variety of goods. There is a butchery department, grocery section, off-licence, post office, green- grocery section and house-hold goods. Most people use the shop just for bits they have forgotten at their main shop. Some people get the week's meat. The customers go into the shop for a chat. There is a regular trade for the shop as many people use it for things they buy everyday, e.g.bread. There is a notice-board outside the shop. A typical notice on the notice-board is "BMX bike for sale, Â£5O". The shop has been run by Mick Thompson for 24 years. The post office is open during shop hours and provides stamps, family allowance, pensions and National Girobank. There is a newspaper delivery service based at the shop.
